column3: Rebased and removed the codes for block validation\n

Looks like you snagged a couple commits from another PR in here. That intentional?

Following this logic, any follow-up softfork from Core codebase would assume previous softforks will be followed then?

Needs rebase. Not sure what the real value of this is, though...why is it a serious offense to relay such blocks? (we'd need careful to avoid any potential network-splitting issues with compact-fast-relay).
close due to lack of interests

I believe this is harmless in this specific case, but not necessary, and makes reasoning about forking risks much harder. The flags enabled for block validation should purely depend on consensus rules.\n
This piece of code is removed in #8525. It may be worth it to rebase on top of that, to reduce the changes?\n
Actually, this shouldn't even have any effect. Since flags in the call to `CheckInputs` below only contains consensus flags, it should never overlap with STANDARD_NOT_MANDATORY_SEGWIT_VERIFY_FLAGS.\n
